Reviews.Title: “Good choice for my visit”
Reviews.Author: 485JB
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 days in Rome and was very pleased with the accommodations. The staff was extremely helpful with suggestions and request. The room was very comfortable and we had a great view of the Villa Borghese and the Roman Wall. The breakfast was very good plus the lobby area was a nice place to sit and use the WiFi. The hotel was convenient to the metro and because the park was across the street, we would leave our window open at night for the breeze and had no loud noises that disturbed our sleep. When I returned to Rome (I threw my coins in the Trevi Fountain), I will stay at Hotel Victoria.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not quite 4 star...”
Reviews.Author: Swee_Swee_23
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Hotel Victoria was not part of mine and my boyfriends plan for Rome however a mix up due to Travel Republic meant our hotel Hotel Mascagni was over booked and they were expecting us a day later than we had booked. They were aware of the problem before we arrived and arranged for us a one night stay at the Hotel Victoria. The staff at the Hotel Victoria were very friendly and understanding of the inconvenience that had been caused to us, they got us swiftly checked in and were helpful in pointing out to us where the hotel was located. The location of Hotel Victoria was good, in walking distance of the Spanish Steps, the Pantheon etc. The hotel itself is clean and the decor in the rooms is let’s say interesting; it seemed whoever designed the rooms wanted to include every pattern and pastel colour going! But no one is going to Rome to stay in the hotel room are they! The room was clean, spacious with a very big bathroom. The shower in the bathroom wasn’t great, it didn’t run very fast at all and for you ladies with long hair that need a hairdryer I would advise you take your own, the hairdryer in the bathroom was useless! The breakfast at the hotel was good, there was scrambled egg, small sausages and bacon plenty of fresh fruit, breads, pastries, fresh juices, cereal, jams etc. Taking into consideration the location of the hotel, the breakfast, the rooms, and the staff I would give Hotel Victoria 3 stars, I think it’s pushing it for 4 stars. With a lick of paint and redecoration it wouldn’t be far off though I guess. Word of warning if you stay at the Hotel Victoria – nothing to do with the hotel but we ate at a place nearby on the main road called Cafe Veneto. (It’s a restaurant next to a restaurant called Harry’s Bar) Don’t waste your money eating here. I have written a lengthy review on trip advisor about this restaurant but in a nutshell, it was poor service, overpriced, ok food - an arrogant money grabbing restaurant! Avoid as there is plenty of choice if you carry on walking down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Bravo to Hotel Victoria”
Reviews.Author: deancappello
Reviews.Content: On a first time trip to Rome with my 15 year old daughter. The staff, especially the front desk, was engaging without being intrusive, was available for anything we needed, and was just made us feel entirely welcome. Room was clean and spacious enough for two of us. The bathroom was new. Room service was good enough and basic enough for us to see it as an option after being out all day. Location is terrific with many things within walking distance. Overall, a great place to stay and priced very reasonably relative to the rest of the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Victoria”
Reviews.Author: martykrahge
Reviews.Content: Ive been traveling to Rome since 1995 for business and it was only last week at I stayed in the Hotel Victoria for the first time. The stay was very nice indeed. Extremely clean and the staff were super friendly. The rooms are a little on the small side but still very nice. It’s a great location at the top of Via Veneto – a short walk to Barberini Square, Spanish Steps & Fontana De Trevi.

Reviews.Title: “not a good place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: evianes
Reviews.Content: the rooms were ok but the service was terrible. 9 out of 10 of the staff were totally rude!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great 4 Star Property”
Reviews.Author: Claude C
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to Villa Borghese and Via Veneto Staff very friendly and helpfull with dinner reservation, still showing the classic Italian concierge flair. Room 5th floor was clean, renovated not long ago, big bathroom, shower head needs replacement, mini bar, pillows could be somewhat softer but oveerall a great room, quite, with efficient windows facing the park American Breakfast was rich and sufficient, fresh pinapple every day, multiple bread choice

Reviews.Title: “Italian Hospitality, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PatriciaJohn
Reviews.Content: Hotel Victoria is in a nice quiet area of Rome, near the Borghese Gardens, and Via Veneto. The front desk staff went out of their way to make us feel at home, especially Nicola and Massimo. We were telling them about a problem we had getting in touch with a company there and before we finished the sentence, they picked up the phone and were calling them for us! We didn't even ask them to do that but they sincerely wanted to be helpful. Breakfast was good: sliced meat, eggs, many bread choices, yogurt, cereals, fresh fruits and juices. Our room was large and comfortable and sparkling clean. It was very cold weather when we were there but our room was warm and comfortable. I asked for an extra pillow and they wanted to know what kind of pillow I prefer, soft or hard! I couldn't believe they cared enough to ask that question. Nearby is Lotti's, a little place that has gelato, panini, bottled drinks, wine, a bakery, and cooked authentic Italian dishes, either to eat there or take away. Great for a quick meal after a long day of touring. There is an underground walkway right near the hotel, and it was very convenient (and dry) to walk toward the Spanish Steps, especially since it snowed when we were there. This is one of the hotels that GreenLine Tour Company designates as a pick-up hotel, so if you book tours, GreenLine tours will pick you up right in the lobby of the hotel, and you won't have to walk anywhere to find them. WiFi is unreliable in the room but there is a direct LAN connection that gives you 100% internet access all the time. The lobby has a WiFi connection and a printer too.

Reviews.Title: “Perillo Tours Hotels were GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: marlna138
Reviews.Content: My sister and I started our Tour in Rome and stayed at the Hotel Victoria. It was Centrally located and made our stay VERY convenient for sight seeing. The staff was VERY Friendly, and always asked if we needed maps or needed any fun ideas for the day! The breakfast was DELICIOUS and we always ate so much we didnt even need to eat lunch! This together with the Perillo Tours made for a very memorable trip. The Tour leader was like family and we all found ourselves joking and laughing and singing even on the bus! We met so many people and made lifelong friends especially with this sweet couple which resides in NY and we cant thank Perillo Tours enough for bringing us all together! I Highly reccomend going on a Perillo Tours, you will be Happy you did!

Reviews.Title: “PERILLO TOURS WAS AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen R
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to Italy last month and were completely blown away. Every recommendation given to us by Perillo Tours was top notch from the restaurants, to the hotel, to the activities. The food was to die for, the hotel was gorgeous and in the perfect location, and our tour guide, Paola, was great! We could not have asked for a better trip. We will definitely be using Perillo Tours again in the future - it's the way to go!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: chinci
Reviews.Content: Excellent ck. in. Friendly, happy poritiere. Room was small, but very cozy. Washroom and Bidet was on one side and huge shower on the other side of the room with lots of glass and chrome. Very clean and shiny. Beautiful crisp and clean linen towels. Very unique elevator, enough room for 2 people at a time. Breakfast was marvelous, fresh and presentation was beautiful. Lovely ceramic bowls and plates and large platters. We really enjoyed it and will go back when we go to Italy next year.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Karen K
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations. The staff, room, location, roof top views and restaurant were all top notch. Our room was exactly as pictured on the hotel site and everything throughout the hotel was well maintained and first class. We will definitely stay here on our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: AquaBlu
Reviews.Content: So glad I found this little hotel! The staff at the service desk were great--always friendly and polite, and very helpful in answering all my questions, booking taxis and tours, making change for large bills, etc. The lobby is tastefully decorated and quite sumptuously furnished. Rooms were very comfortable and well-appointed, with a large bathroom, comfy bed, cable TV in several languages, and internet access. A room safe and minibar are also included. Breakfast was very good, with a tasty assortment of croissants and breads, fruits, yogurt, and hot items such as bacon and eggs. The location was excellent (right off the Via Veneto and directly across from the Villa Borghese), a 10-minute walk from the Metro station (Linea A, with direct connections to the Vatican Museums/St. Paul's and Termini station for only 1 euro--I took the metro and it was perfectly safe). Right around the corner from the hotel is a nice restaurant called "Il Pomodorino" that serves a variety of traditional Italian dishes for a reasonable price. To get to the colosseum, just take the metro to Termini and transfer for the Linea B to "Colosseo" (only 1 euro, much cheaper than a taxi!). Be careful of taxis in Rome, even the "official" ones sometimes have shady drivers who will gyp you big-time--when I first arrived, the taxi from Termini to the hotel took the "long way" and charged me 18 euros, and then the driver literally stole from me (when I gave him a 50-euro note, he sneakily switched it for a 10 and said it wasn't enough for the fare, then loudly argued with me until I figured it was safer to just give him the other 8 and just walk away). On the way back, I had the hotel concierge book me a taxi to Termini, and the same trip cost only 9 euros and was only about 10 blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rwilson1961
Reviews.Content: Our group stayed at this hotel in October 2011. The hotel is clean, has an excellent location, and a helpful staff. The rooms were large, fresh, and comfortable. I would highly recommend this hotel to others who are planning a trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Service”
Reviews.Author: Michael S
Reviews.Content: Hotel Victoria is an excellent choice when in Rome. The rooms are large and comfortable, the public area beautiful and well-appointed, and the dining room very nice. The location is excellent; just a few blocks from the U.S. Embassy. The staff is friendly and on-it. Perhaps most spectacular is the roof-top bar and restaurant. Bedecked with wonderful foliage, it is one of the niucest spots in the cusy city.

Reviews.Title: “could not have asked for more”
Reviews.Author: daletravelevans
Reviews.Content: great buffet breakfasts with wonderful servers pleasant, knowledgeable front desk staff - went above and beyond to be helpful including Ricola, Massimo and Adrian. Enjoyed the rooftop bar - peaceful with a wonderful view. Hotel centrally located to many sites and great restaurants including Il Pomodorino just down the block. I had a large sunny corner room overlooking borghese gardens with a small patio. The room was always cleaned to perfection. Would only ask that the hotel puts safety bars in the bath. choose this hotel and you will have a great time dale

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: chaz48
Reviews.Content: in july my step son, daughter-in-law , wife and grandkid's stayed there for 2/12 day's, after visiting family in the abruzzio regin .what a great hotel. really nice room's , very clean , quiet and a very nice staff . the hotel is really nicely located in rome , near great shop's and dining . plus it was one of a few hotel's that had a roof top dining , with beauful view's of rome . great menue and nice selection of wine's . i love my fine wine's .

Reviews.Title: “Keeps getting better!!”
Reviews.Author: ninarital
Reviews.Content: I don't understand negative reviews about this exceptional hotel. This is my fourth stay and we are going back in April of 2012. My room was large and sunny with a balcony overlooking the Aurelian Wall and the Borghese Gardens!! The hotel staff are amazing!! All of them. I had hurt my knee and one gentleman brought me a cane from home when I asked where I could buy one. We stayed four nights and then went to S.M. Ligure and back for four nights. I had left my passport and 300 E behind, or at least I hoped I had.Upon my return all the staff said." your portofolio is here and safe." It was and so was the 300 E. My room was immaculately kept and my bath room was enormous.My bed was very comfortable. The pillows a bit flat, but I am stretching to make a mini negative comment. Great bkfst. and a gorgeous roof garden to sit and read as my knee kept me pretty stationary. I have been to Rome several dozen times and I have stayed all over this magnificent city. The Victoria is my home in Rome! I can't imagine any of the staff being," curt or unfriendly." Maybe the vibes people give off come back to them? I can't wait for April so i can stay here a roam as I was not able to this trip. I also recommend the restaurant Il Pomodorino out the front door to the right, less than a block. Good food, great prices. You will be very happy if you chose this wonderful hotel. Patricia

Reviews.Title: “Bad beds and quirky staff”
Reviews.Author: Chris C
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week there (October 2011) and have stayed there before but never again. The beds are horrible - old and soft; you can feel the springs and very spongy. Pillows are like stone. The front desk staff act like they're doing you a favor by helping you. I found them to be curt and unfriendly. They offer airport shuttle service for 10 Euro more than a cab 200 feet away would charge - and the shuttle is a cab from the same company. Maid service is great and the free breakfast is very nice. The free internet service is spotty. They have 4 different networks and only one worked (open rooftop terrace). The lobby and reading room are very nice, with many comfortable chairs and well lit. Best bet, however, is to stay elsewhere for all round better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Victoria is excellent.”
Reviews.Author: HallStars4
Reviews.Content: Location is good!! Price is acceptable. The rooftop terrace is awesome!! The breakfast for a hotel in Europe is excellent!! Nicole at the front desk was very helpful in recommending restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: angelavol
Reviews.Content: Hotel Victoria was excellent. Location was good!! Beautiful bathrooms. The rooftop terrace was awesome!! The breakfast for a hotel in Europe was excellent!! Nicole at the front desk was very helpful in recommending restaurants in the area.The rest of the front desk staff was not very friendly!!

Reviews.Title: “great location - old fashioned style hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelling006
Reviews.Content: stayed here for one night, the location is fantastic, next to villa borghese and 5 min walk to the spanish steps and centre of rome! the hotel is very old fashioned, rooms also. big hotel with big lobby and breakfast area but hotel could do with a little renovation, as carpets, curtains and wallpaper are wearing a little and hotels misses a little bit of "punch" rooms were very clean, very big room for a hotel in rome! bathroom was huge aswell, bath included. curtains should be replaced in the rooms and beds are not too comfortable, very hard. no wifi in the bedrooms, only by cable. breakfast was standard. the staff were extremely friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: abisorkk
Reviews.Content: Excelent hotel. Clean, gentle Service especiall Andreian in the front desk, good location, non expansive, free internet at room.

Reviews.Title: “Good location...”
Reviews.Author: Carson D
Reviews.Content: Close to Villa Borghese in the beautiful part of Rome beside Via Veneto. The rooms are clean and elegant, with a large bathroom. The breakfast was very good as well.

Reviews.Title: “A rooftop garden bar and restaurant to die for!”
Reviews.Author: gra-semi-retired
Reviews.Content: Very nice clean hotel in a good location with an amazing roof top bar where we relaxed and met other guests. The service was very good too. Loved the location too.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bamaboy62
Reviews.Content: Close to all the tourist stuff, great breakfast, quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: js c
Reviews.Content: A beautiful room in a posh and clean hotel with a great view on the villa borghese. The staff is very friendly and helpfull. Parking is free just across the street with a disk you need to tune every three hours. The terrasse is the perfect place for a little spinello at dusk. Rome is a lively, clean and amazing city. You want to sceem "waw, it's like waw" at every corner.

Reviews.Title: “really enjoy my stay”
Reviews.Author: carlosleo
Reviews.Content: was the first time staying at the hotel Victoria, i really liked the hotel because it s centrally located and within 10-15 minutes walking you reach spanish steps.the rooftop was amazing full of flowers, and a nice view i ordered a steak at the restaurant and the chef cooked with barbecue and i really appreciated, in the terrace there is also the bar and it s the best place if you want to relax.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel in a nice area of rome”
Reviews.Author: jedi_yorks
Reviews.Content: this is our third visit to this hotel and we will be going back again. The hotel is in a good area of rome, a little away from the famous sites but not too bad, and there is a bus (the 116) which stops nearby and goes to all the usual places, so its a good idea to get a ticket (cheaper than taxis). Rooms are nice and a decent size for Rome, where often the rooms are very small, I must admit they could probably do with updating the decor, but they are always clean so its not a major criticism. There is a restaurant on the roof terrace in summer which is nice, but personally, we liked the bar (also on the roof) better, and you can get light snacks there which were very good. The staff were very friendly and helpful, breakfast was okay, not great but not bad either. A good tip is to go to the Villa Borghese, the museum there is brilliant, and the gardens are lovely for just relaxing away from the hustle and bustle.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: STXJohn
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the area of upscale hotels on via veneto. The hotel has small rooms. Wifi works in 5th floor rooms. Rooms quite, staff friendly. All and all a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: ND6Traveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel when we were on our Honeymoon. Our first stop was in London so we had high expectations for Rome because the London leg of our honeymoon was AWESOME (Mint Hotel in Westminster is highly recommended). While London was nice and cool, Rome was extremely hot and HUMID. Unfortunately, the AC in our hotel room was not the best (I was warned that that AC's in europe are not what we are used to in the US). The lowest it would go was 78 degrees. That is not good when it's in the 90's and the humidity is in the 90's as well. The room was smaller than the pictures showed but the staff was very friendly and helpful. Its a small hotel and there are a few restaurants near it that you should try. The gelato place was a great place to go to. We ate at the rooftop restaurant and it was pretty good. Great view, especially at night and the food was good. The area around the hotel is known as Via Veneto and it has a few upscale restaurants and hotels (hard rock cafe and US embassy are close) so it's not as cheap as some other places we found to eat at when we would walk around in the city. There is this tunnel that the concierge told us to walk through that lead us straight to the spanish steps. It was a nice reprieve from the beating sun. The hotel is actually a good value but there are other hotels closer to the main sites. The hotel is about 15 minutes from the spanish steps so it's not bad either. A quick tip, when you order pizza, they charge by the weight. So when someone tries to give you a whole pizza, SAY NO, or you will be charged alot of money.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Nick_T58
Reviews.Content: Clearly once a classy hotel, it badly needs a major refreshment. Staff friendly and helpful but the hotel overall should be much better at the prices they are charging.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, quiet, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tradurn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a week's holiday in Rome and we would have found it hard to find a nicer hotel. The hotel itself is lovely. The traditional decoration in the public areas is impressive and the room was very comfortable, clean, quiet and peaceful which, given the level of noise in Rome both day and night, is most appreciated. The only minor downside was that breakfast was the same every day, but there was a fair choice and you could have as much as you wanted as often as you wanted. The service at breakfast left a little to be desired but I would put some of this down to something being lost in translation. The “front of house” staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The concierge was extremely knowledgeable about the tourist attractions of Rome and was more than happy to give advice as to the best way of reaching them. Similarly the hall porter was one of the most helpful and friendly people we have ever come across working in a hotel, nothing was too much trouble for him. Having spent a week there it is unlikely that we will be going back to Rome anytime soon, but I would have no hesitation recommending the Hotel Victoria to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “An outstanding hotel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: rose1055118
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Victoria Hotel for a week .The room we got was big outstandingly clean-when we got it and on the rest of the week as well. The breakfast was good .We personally missed more vegetables.It isn't very close to all thr main attractions in Rome but it is placed in a very short walk from transportation.It is in a v ery quiet steet and the noise of such a busy city as Rome doesn't bother you at all.All staff members were very nice.At the top floor there is a very nice restaurant on the open with a great view. The only thing that may be changed is the softness of their pillows but even with the ones they have we slept well.If we will return to Rome we will surely stay at The Victoria Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Hotel Victoria”
Reviews.Author: keennicole
Reviews.Content: I spent a great deal of time researching hotels for our trip to Rome, and finally decided on Hotel Victoria. It ended up being a great choice. The staff was very friendly, efficient , and helpful. Our room was very nice. We stayed in an double upgraded room. I don't know if the superior double was worth the difference in money because I didn't see the other rooms. Breakfast was good and we did enjoy the roof top terrace for drinks and sandwiches. The weather was hot at the end of June. High during the day was close to 90 degrees farenheit. After a long day of touring it was great to come back to outstanding air conditioning in our room. It was a quiet part of the city, just around the corner from Via Veneto. Would definitely stay there again and recommend to friends

Reviews.Title: “Stay AWAY!!!”
Reviews.Author: mariobono
Reviews.Content: Worst place on earth. Horrible people! Would rather sleep in the streets of Rome then stay at this hotel. Spend your money wisely and pay for a little bit better accommodations you will only thank yourself later.

Reviews.Title: “NIce place - you get what you pay for....”
Reviews.Author: beast71
Reviews.Content: Spent a week here with a tour group; fine breakfasts/dinners. Room OK - shower never worked and they couldn't fix it. Front desk could never make change. Undermanned/staffed at front desk. Wifi worked most of the time. Recommend bringing your own pillow if you don't like them hard as rocks. Rooms are HOT in winter - you have to open windows to cool them down, then the noise gets you. No fans. It was worth the price given location. Get a room NOT on a street. Everyone very polite. Centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was good, location...uh ok, service not so great, overall Good place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Jbratcher2544
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really outdated. There was no WIFI. You only had internet via data cables that you had to rent out and fight over becuase they didnt have enough to accomadate their guests. Elevators were small, rooms were cozy, view wasnt so great from the room. Its really close to the Church of the bones, spanish steps, the LIttle Tomato pizza restraunt wich is GREAT!~ A MUST ! ! ! ! ! Were not treated fair by a restruant located on the back side of this hotel. I cannot remember the name of that one though. Overall the hotel was ok. I guess I wasnt so thrilled because it was our last hotel and the last 2 3 nights of the trip wich meant we were going to have to leave and come home.

Reviews.Title: “4 star hotel ; would stay there again ..”
Reviews.Author: parroteyes
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in mid-October. Recommended by our travel agent- this was our first trip to Rome. Front desk people were very friendly and helpful and bellmen were great!! Room rate included breakfast each morning. Breakfast was OK, not as many offerings as I had expected but enough to get you going for the day. Did not eat lunch or dinner at the hotel because we were usually out in Rome during that time. Hotel was clean; our room was very clean and very nice -- we were very happy with the room. Bathroom was quite large and very clean. Hotel did have a computer off the main lobby which was free if you didn't bring a laptop to your room. It was VERY HELPFUL to have access to that computer. There was a travel agency right at the corner street at the hotel and they were very helpful for buying train tickets ahead of time if you didn't want to purchase them at the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: fbradham
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 wonderful nights in this hotel. Location is great - just a block off Via Veneto and beautiful views of the wall and Villa Borghese. Staff arranged a personal driver to meet us at the airport for the same cost a taxi would be. Rooms clean and breakfast is excellent with quality service -- and scrambled eggs. Hotel was recommended by a friend who stayed frequently on business and his recommendation was right on!

Reviews.Title: “A great find at a decent price”
Reviews.Author: tdew99
Reviews.Content: Our large group of friends ended a cruise in Rome and spent a few pleasant days at the Victoria Roma. The helpful, cheerful staff, good breakfast and comfortable location all made our stay a good one. The rooms are all different from one another - some are nicer than others while others are a bit unusual. We would be happy to stay there again on a return trip. We very much enjoyed the restaurant just down to the right of the hotel entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: jbyrkje
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights at Hotel Victoria in September 2010. We had a pleasant stay and the hotel met our expectation and deserved the 4-stars rating. The room was ok and clean. The bathroom was quiet small but up to date. The breakfast was part of the room rate and includes everything you expect. . The location is a little a "out of town" when it comes to attraction but still within walking distance to all major sites. But than again very quiet. aera during nighttime. The staff overall were all very friendly and helpful. Will recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Via Veneto without the price tag.”
Reviews.Author: WellesleyDriver
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 7 nights and enjoyed our large room and beautiful bath. The roof top restaurant and lounge allowed us to stay "home" after a long day (twice), but still enjoy a special meal in a fantastic location. With a little shopping, Via Veneto has some decent meal values, too. The hotel's location is a block from Via Veneto in a quieter spot, very close to Villa Borghese and next to the Aurelian Wall. I can't say enough about the location, a short walk to the Spanish Steps (about the same elevation as Trinita dei Monti and the Hassler), the Trident shopping streets and even Piazza del Popolo. The cab stand, 200 meters away (corner of Via Veneto), always had taxis waiting when we wanted to venture farther afield. The "free" breakfast had a great selection, allowing me to start every day with melon and prosiutto and a cappuccino. This was our second visit and we were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed with room quality”
Reviews.Author: wynberg
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights due to an overbooking at original hotel. Room on fourth floor was small and very sparsely furnished. Carpet was threadbare, dirty, and patched in several places (presumably where worse stains had occurred). One patch was not even glued down and could be lifted clear of the floor. Walls were painted a yellow colour and were scuffed and marked. The only chair in the room was similar to one you might find at a garage sale. TV had maybe about 20" screen. Washroom was acceptable. Rooftop bar was nice and breakfast area and food was acceptable. The hotel describes itself as deluxe but room 409 is budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but it is a walk...”
Reviews.Author: Sparky023
Reviews.Content: Hotel Victoria is a great hotel. It has great rooms, delicious breakfast buffet, and very personable people working the front desk. The rooftop bar/ restaurant is a nice touch. The hotel is a 15 minute walk from the nearest metro stop, up a hill. It is not really centrally located. You could also walk to the Spagna metro stop, but it is also 15 minutes, through one or two different tunnels. Just take note of what is in your mini-bar. I suppose they never checked the mini-fridge before we arrived. They tried to charge us for all this stuff we never used.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: bermudalover98
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Italy this summer with my family and another family. Our first stop was Rome. After MUCH research , we deicided on Hotel Victoria. I was not disappointed. First of all it is hard to find a hotel to sleep a family of 4. We were able to get adjoining rooms so we had 2 bathrooms which was great. The bathrooms were very large and clean. The complimentary breakfast was amazing, it is served in a beautiful dining room. We had dinner on the roof top terrace which was really beautiful. The hotel is located very close to all the major sights. Just a short walk. I highly recommend this hotel. I am very picky when it comes to hotels....I drive my husband nuts about it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Metusalem
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed for 4 days. The staff in the reception was friendly and helpfull. The room was very good. Eating at the terrasse is a` "must do". In the city, we must warn about "restaurant-pushers". In the area of the Trevi-fountain, we where "pushed" and we had to pay 86 euro for 2 dishes of pasta, 2 glass of vine, and a`bottle of water, and suddently the waiter could not understand english. Then we found a´ very good and cheap place in via in Arcione 89, called Pizza roma. Well, I didnt write much about the hotel, and there is not much to say than it is a recomendable hotel and we certainly would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel lived up to all the positive reviews I had read before going.”
Reviews.Author: Emme59
Reviews.Content: I truly enjoyed our trip to Rome, mainly because of the fine service, breakfast, and I enjoyed the great spacious bathroom. Our days in Rome were filled with daily activities and excursions; the breakfast room was opened at 6:30 a.m., so the kids and I could start our day early. Fruits, breads, eggs, meats, and great coffee were available daily, one could have a hearty meal which would tie us over till dinner. The room and bathroom was extremely clean and spacious. The taxie stand, fermata (bus stop) were just a short block away. Via Veneto is just a block away, we felt very safe in this area. Villa Borghese was just across the street. We used Rome as a base camp, travelling to Florence, Assisi, Naples, and Pompeii, a travel agency is just across the street organized our train tickets and plans. Rick Steve's Europe Through the Back Door was very helpful. We only ventured to Termini to catch our train. We only encountered one dishonest taxi driver, most charged around 7 euros to take you to major sites. We tried to do most of the sites following the Rick Steves' guide; the only tour my husband booked for us was to Naples and Pompeii, we were grateful for that, we met a gentleman on the train to Florence, he was Naples native, who sort of recommended we not venture out there by ourselves; I told him we had a tour and said "good". The only other negative thing to report happened in Florence; I needed to get some laundry done, went to a Wash & Dry a street down from the Duomo; the facility was clean and good. Everything was going well, my two loads of clothing were washed and I placed them in two separate dryers, I was the only person in the facility, it started to get a little hot, so I stood right outside the door, watching my clothes and taking the breeze from outside; then a Italian man from a Pub, two doors down, walked in, I remained outside, looking in, I thought he was going to get change, and while I turned away for a second, took my son's t-shirt and sox from the dryer. It happened sooo quick I was completely fooled. I realized he had taken the piece of clothing when I was folding my clothes. He looked like a perfect gentleman. So be careful, when doing laundry in Florence. There are thieves everywhere in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Marvelous”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugBoston
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel...rooms were large by European standards, staff was very friendly and accomodating. Best of all was the rooftop lounge and restaurant. Food was wonderful and it was marvelous to be able to dine while watching the sun set over the city of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: yogiEastbourne
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Rome staying at the Hotel Victoria. This is a beautiful hotel with excellent staff and situated in a good position just on the outskirts of Rome. It takes about 15 minutes to walk into the centre of Rome where the Trevi Fountain is etc. Breakfasts are served in a lovely dining room with plenty to choose from. We very much enjoyed the lovely terrace on the top of the hotel with lovely flowers everywhere where you can have a drink and evening meal. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff - rooms very small”
Reviews.Author: shakemartini
Reviews.Content: Wanted to get room service for a pot of coffee and two cups, they told me they did not do that. I was so upset, that I went to the front desk, he was just rude and told me they did deliver coffee to the rooms. He then made smart comment, I told him that is just how room service acted. He told me I would get a pot of coffee. By the tears were in my eyes, do you have to fight for even coffee? The manager hear us and told me the coffee would be delivered. Well, we did not get the coffee, so I called the manager, he could not understand why we had not gotten the coffee, a hour had passed. Just rude employees. Maybe if they had been a bit nicer we would have liked this hotel. Would never stay there again. Construction under our window all day , drilling!!!! Room was so small I could not open the door to the closet it hit the bed. Very disappointed with this hotel. Perillo Tours recommend the hotel as first class, they better look again!!!

Reviews.Title: “4 star hotel with quiet flair”
Reviews.Author: jik
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night "girls'" (ok-45 yrs +) trip, staying here and we were very comfortable.Staff were all helpful and easygoing.My friends are German and they were pleased to see how clean everything was.Rooms are fairly small but more than adequate -.decor is antique mock crossed with modern pattern mix(not sure how to describe it!) Good breakfast buffet by Italian standards-you can order all hot drinks unlimited when you breakfast.Distances between sights are not so far (like Paris,less than London) so downhill walk from hotel via Via Veneto with bus stops/metro are all convenient.Quietish, not very atmospheric area but after hours of exhausting sightseeing we were happy to return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff, lovely location, lovely hotel! :)”
Reviews.Author: CDPM
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in Hotel Victoria in September 2007 for 3 days before heading down the coast to Sorrento. It's located at the old walls of the city. It's a lovely quiet area. From check in we were made to feel welcome! There were maps ready everyday to find our way around, with the city sites located on it. This I have to say was just so handy, saved us having to bring a travel guide. The hotel is far enough away and close enough to the activity to make it a pleasant stay. No noise but close enough to enjoy walking to the Trevi Fountain. The rooms were small, but it's a city hotel so it didn't bother us. The en-suites were very small but again, not a major deal in my opinion. The rooms were clean, the beds were comfy and relaxing. The dinner service, like the every other meal here was beautiful with the friendliest staff!! Nothing was too much, and caviar and proseco compliments of the chef were a fantastic little treat!! Great place to stay for a city break in rome

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: lkhing
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 weeks vacation in Europe and would like to share with you our experience at the hotel we stayed in Rome. We stayed at the Hotel Victoria for 5 nights before and 2 nights after our cruise. We had a very pleasant experience as the hotel exceeded our every expectation and well deserved the 4-stars rating. The hotel is located close to a major street (Via Venato). While it is a bit away from some major tourist sites, it is quieter at night which allows us a good night’ sleep and is still within walking distance to all major sites. We were able to walk to all the main Rome attraction s within half an hour from the hotel; about 5 minutes from Spanish Steps where great shopping is available and just across the street from Borghese Garden. We found the neighborhood very safe and pleasant to wonder. If you are traveling with family members, the family room is the way to go. We stayed in a family room that is very big and comfortable. It has a King bed and 2 pulled out twin beds from a sofa. The bathroom is enormous with 2 washbasins and a tub/shower. We were warned by friends to be prepared for very small hotel rooms in Europe. This is a large room; larger than most hotels we stayed at in US/Canada. The room is well equipped. Although the furnitures are old, they are maintained in good shape and cleaned. Ironed linen are replaced daily. We were very impressed with the room overall. If you book the room rate that includes the breakfast, the buffet breakfast is very nice. It is served in the dining room and includes pretty much anything you could imagine, from cold cut to scrambled eggs, bacons and sausages, and various types of breads and pastries and fresh fruits. The server will offer you choices of hot beverages, from lemon tea to real Italian coffee. We were impressed with the classy setting with nice and clean table clothe and clothe napkins, similar to some 5 stars hotels. We enjoyed a nice and relaxing breakfast each morning before heading out to explore the city. Without exceptions, the staffs are very friendly, polite and professional all the time. As a guest, they made you feel attended to and important. They attended to all our requests and questions immediately. They are also very good in recommending restaurants/cafes that offer excellent Italian cuisine at very reasonable prices. We would definite stay at this hotel again and highly recommend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some fair, overall solid”
Reviews.Author: HHD3413
Reviews.Content: The good - Very clean, huge bathroom, comfortable bed, beautiful common areas including breakfast room and rooftop bar. Helpful and friendly staff. Very good breakfast. The fair - Not the greatest location from which to visit other sites. Actual shower/tub was oddly configured. Airport shuttle service a bit of a ripoff. A little on the pricey side. Overall, solid but not spectacular hotel. I would stay here again, but then again I might also look for something a little closer to the major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay for family of four”
Reviews.Author: TravelBunch
Reviews.Content: Traditional hotel close to Borghese Park, across the street from the Hadrian Walls made for a great base for our family of four. Room was spacious and tidy, fold out beds comfortable and linens were crisp and clean. Bathroom was huge, very clean, double sinks and nice shower. PROS: Large family room accomodated our 11 and 12 year olds nicely. Clean, comfortable and spacious. Nice location with many local small restaurants serving excellent food in casual setting. Try the Pomodorino around the corner, perfect after a long day of travel. The Continental Breakfast is excellent, including eggs, breads, cold cuts, cheeses, fruits, juices and coffee/tea served in traditional dining area with tablecloths and comfortable seating. In a nice location, surrounded by other hotels, nice restaurants and residential buildings. Convenient to auto rental offices too. Free internet access wired into room, high speed. CONS: If you're expecting a Westin or "W" experience you will be disappointed. But if you have the proper expectations, it is very good. This is a classic hotel in a residential section of Rome, but not fancy or posh. It is comfortable, clean, traditional and a great value. Quiet at night and surrounded by nice restaurants. We would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “A typical italian experience, wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: cat40_9
Reviews.Content: This hotel came with good reviews, and we were not disappointed. The hotel sitting in the middle of one of the nicest area's of Rome. It is a short walk to the spanish steps and this is where you will find the designer shops. Rome is a fantastic city filled with a diverse range of bars and restaurants. If you want to stay in a typical italian hotel, quaint if a little tired, this all adds to the charm. The staff were all very friendly and helpful, the breakfast was adequate and nicely served. The room was clean and spacious. And larger than expected. After all in Rome you will not want to spend much time here anyway. There is too much to see. I am definately going back there, for the money its well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel in Fabulous City”
Reviews.Author: saadb
Reviews.Content: I found Hotel Victoria through internet research and comments made on TripAdvisor by other travelers and I have to say the hotel lived up to its reputation. Great location, facing the Borghese Gardens, great staff, excellent services, spacious rooms with all amenities, beautiful bathrooms, impeccable hygiene and very warm decor. Rome is one of my favorite cities in the world and this hotel made the experience even more enjoyable. I will definitely come back and would recommend the hotel to anyone who is traveling to rome and is looking for a reasonably priced 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in Rome”
Reviews.Author: TravelOneUS
Reviews.Content: Having never been to Rome before, I spent many hours on the Internet over several months researching hotels and areas. Using TripAdvisor and some other sites, I finally ended up choosing the Hotel Victoria Roma and could not have made a better choice for our nine night stay. This is a terrific hotel in a quiet area at the top of Via Veneto. Most of the rooms have been recently remodeled and are first rate. I suspect that some recent negative reviews were due to a room that hadn’t yet been remodeled. Make sure you get one that has been and you won’t be disappointed. As with most European hotels in older buildings, the rooms vary in size. We had a superior double room and it was plenty big enough, with a very generous size bathroom. The full breakfast was outstanding with eggs, hot and cold meats, cheeses, pastries, cereal, fresh fruit, and, of course, coffee any way you want it. We rarely ate lunch while sightseeing after having their breakfast. The hotel is just the right size. Not too large and not too small. The public spaces are very nicely decorated and inviting. The two elevators are fast and you never have to wait more than a few seconds. But, the best part is the staff. There are four or five people who rotate at the front desk and they are all very friendly and helpful. They are fluent in English as well as several other languages. Being a mid sized hotel, there is no concierge, per se. The front desk people provide that function and do it exceedingly well. We ate in the hotel restaurant our last night and the food was excellent. It’s a little pricey, but still not as much as the restaurants on Via Veneto. Most nights we ate in little neighborhood restaurant on the next street called La Bruschetta and the food was outstanding as well as reasonably priced. There is one caveat with this hotel. The rooms along the back are on a street with a club that seems to stay open very late. People were out on the street until 2 or 3 am and they were very loud. Apparently, this is not unusual in Rome. On our first few nights we had trouble sleeping due to the noise. In the winter this may not be a problem, because you can shut the windows. It in the summer it may also be alright when the air conditioning is running. But, we were there at the end of April and they hadn’t started running the air conditioning yet, so we wanted to leave the windows open. The hotel management was very understanding and moved us to a front room on the fifth floor. It was a great room with a view of Borghese Park. There is a major highway that runs near the front of the hotel, so there is some traffic noise, but that didn’t keep us up at all. The Hotel Victoria is a terrific hotel and a wonderful oasis, if that is what you want. The toughest part of picking a hotel in Rome is knowing what part of the city you want to sleep in. If you are not familiar with Rome, you need to know that it is crowded, fast, and chaotic. Traffic moves at an incredible pace, stoplights and pedestrian are essentially ignored, and the sidewalks, such as they are, are crowded with tourist and natives. If you don’t’ mind the crowds and commotion and want to be where the “action” is, then you probably want to stay around the Piazza Navona or some other high activity area. But if you want to get away from it all at the end of the day and have a pleasant, friendly home away from home, then by all means stay at the Hotel Victoria.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Experience at Three Star Prices!”
Reviews.Author: SilverSideUp
Reviews.Content: My family and I first travelled to Milan and came to Rome via air. We booked the hotel at the airport itself! Always keep in mind that the rates at the stations and airports are always the cheapest. The regular prices are about E300 for a room but we got the room at a "take-it-or-leave-it" rate of E170! The sweet woman at the counter reccomended it to us. It is a four star hotel housed in a beautiful building in one of the posh areas of Rome so all the shops, restaurants, etc. around are a little overpriced but the area is beautiful, very safe and overlooks the Gate of Rome which we could see just outside our room window. It is walking distance from many of the tourist sights, the main road (one of the most important in Rome) Via Veneto and very close to Spagna and Barberini Paizzas and Metro Stations. It is also surrounded by lovely shops, cafes and restuarants. When in Rome try your best to use public transport or whenever possible WALK because you see something beautiful on every steet corner and always carry a map! The weather was great when we went there so you don't get tired walking. Plus it's healthy for you! The staff at the hotel were very warm like most Italians are! They were very helpful and told us some nice local places to visit and also helped us learn a few Italian words for easier communication with the locals. Most locals DON'T speak English well so it becomes a bit of a problem but they're wonderful people so you figure things out eventually! The breakfast was quite good and if you request something special a day or two in advance, they will readily get it for you. if you ask nicely enough they could pack a wholesome breakfast incase you have an early morning tour. There was an old, grumpy maitre'd in the restaurant but we didn't mind him since he was an old-timer and was always adorably grumpy with everyone! The amenities, quality etc. of the hotel was of five star status. The rooms were large and comfy and the bathroom was lovely. The beautiful city with it's wonderful people and this really great hotel makes Rome a perfect spot to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: gina1beana
Reviews.Content: I read several reviews before booking this hotel and was very excited to stay here. I can't tell you how disappointed we were. Not only did the hotel smell bad but only the bathrooms were renovated. The floor , beds , linens were so old they were faded. The bed was about as comforable as the floor as well as the pillows. The shower only had extremly hot or cold water and the bath tub was stained and gross. The hotel is not near anything and is a far walk to most restaurants and shops. I would NOT recommend staying here, especially for the price it should have been about 1/4 of what we paid for this night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel; Great location”
Reviews.Author: kathieann
Reviews.Content: Since my husband and I had been to Rome several times , we wanted to stay where we could walk to just about everything. We definitely made the right choice. During our week's stay, we found nothing to complain about. Our double room was large, had 2 balconies which faced the Borghese gardens and had a large bathroom. Our room was spotless as was the rest of the hotel. The complimentary breakfast was delicious and consisted of eggs, cereals, meats, cheeses, croissants, muffins, juices, and coffee. What more could you possibly ask for? You are in Italy, not the US! Everyone was courteous, pleasant and helpful. The rooftop terrace was closed during our stay, but don't forget to see Angelo in the lobby lounge. He's wonderful!!

Reviews.Title: “No complaints!”
Reviews.Author: louisecu123
Reviews.Content: I really liked the Hotel Victoria, only around the corner from the top of the spanish steps, yet in a nice and quiet/relaxing part of Rome. The rooms are small but spotless and modern and everything is within easy reach. The open bus tour is a must..it brings you to all the main attractions. The reception staff were extremely helpful and polite. The food in the hotels restaurant was a little over priced for the standard but there are plenty of others in the area which were gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “A little overpriced and removed from the main attractions”
Reviews.Author: mg_103
Reviews.Content: We had a couple of issues with this hotel, and we definitely did not get our money's worth. We stayed here for three nights and paid about $530 for all 3 nights. This hotel is categorized as a 4-star in expedia, but it does not come close! We thought the hotel had been remodeled, that may have been a long time ago - the carpets are quite dirty (first sign of no recent renovation) the comforter looked as it had never been washed, and as a matter of fact the cleaning crew removed it after our first night... The bathroom was very spacious, and fairly clean but the tub/shower has clear panels instead of curtains, and these do not close all the way through - we found this quite funny actually. The interesting part about this hotel is that its advertised as a top hotel chain across Europe but it did not feel that way at all. Location wise - its a bit removed from the main attractions, we managed to walk to most of them - a lot of walking, but we would definitely stay at a hotel closer to the center next time. This hotel should be priced at no more than $75 - $100 per night with its current condition.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great stay.”
Reviews.Author: Astria
Reviews.Content: I was a little hesitant after reading a couple of the previous reviews. I had NOTHING to worry about. We had a wonderful stay. The location was excellent. We were less than one minute's walk from Via Veneto (a street filled with shops, restaurants, etc.) and about a five minute's walk from the train station. We took the train almost everywhere. From the airport, I'd recommend taking a shuttle or the Leonardo Express then a taxi (it's a little hard to navigate from the nearest train station with luggage). The Leo Express is about 15 Euro, and a taxi should be about 6 Euro. Don't let the unlicensed taxis get to you! The hotel is very nice. Courteous staff -helpful, considerate and speak English very well. Internet access was provided via keyboard in the room hooked up to a TV (7 Euros for 24 hours), or you could use the computer downstairs for 5 Euros. Didn't check out the restaurant since there were way too many to choose from in the area. The train will take you wherever you want to go if you don't want to walk. We felt this was a perfect location - we felt very safe, yet still in the middle of the action on Via Veneto. Rooms are small (expect this anywhere in Europe), but we didn't feel they were uncomfortable. Bring washcloths. They don't provide them. Again, great service. I'm used to staying in "nice" hotels (i.e. 5 star), and although it didn't provide the ammenities a 5 star hotel does (spa, etc.) I didn't have any complaints. After all, we were there to see Rome - not the inside of the hotel. If I return to Rome, I'd definitely stay here again. I'd recommend it to anyone. There is a bar (i think others have mentioned this) literally around the corner with some of the best espresso (cafe) we had anywhere in Rome. It just says "bar". Leaving the hotel, turn left and immediately turn left on the first street. Then turn right at the first street and you'll see it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, freindly staff, good location, great value”
Reviews.Author: daviddtb
Reviews.Content: Arrived with my wife for a week and had a great time. The location is very good. a 5 minutes walk from the busy center so it's quite but not remote. 50m from the lovely via Veneto, and in fron of ancient wall of Rome. The staff very friendly and most of them speak English. The room was quite small but clean and has everything you need. Didn't spent much time there. The breakfast is very rich and nice and is a great start for a day of dicovering this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Good value with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Company_President
Reviews.Content: My room was clean and comfortable with crisp bed linen. In many ways the hotel is similar in standard to the nearby Westin Excelsior, where I have stayed before, but at a much lower price. The hotel staff were very friendly, helpful and made me feel genuinely welcome. The hotel is conveniently situated close to the Villa Borghese and Via Veneto. and the Spanish Steps are 10-15 minutes walk away. There are restaurants, shops and bars nearby. Overall, I enjoyed my stay at this hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: FredWashington
Reviews.Content: Hotel Victoria is in a great location, steps from the Via Veneto and not far from several main tourist attractions in Rome. The staff was friendly for the most part and they served a very nice buffet breakfast with plenty of choices. Our room was very spacious which was welcome as we had a port-a-crib in the room with us. The bathroom was quite large as well. The hotel is a bit old and you can see it in the fixtures and the decor. The hotel is very quiet -- I don't know if it was because it's not the high season, or if it's always this way, but we rarely saw anyone in the lobby or any guests hanging out at the hotel bar. So, if you are looking for a quiet, private place to stay, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bluenoser8
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Victoria from Nov2 to Nov 5 2008 ahead of a cruise. The location was great. Walking distance to most major sites, Colosseum, Trevie,Spanish Steps,etc. Staff were very helpful in giving directions, taxies, places to eat and putting up with endless questions. The bartender in the main bar was a great guy. Breakfast buffet was more than ample as we never left hungry. Always had something to eat and the coffee was samazing. Rooms were clean and well looked after. General condition of the hotel was very good and seemed to be well maintained. Elevator was small, but this gave it charm. Some street noisebut not enough to keep us awake. Lots of local restaurants to eat at that were not too expensive. Overall a great little hotel. If you like a bit of formality in a small hotel, this is the place. The cliental will not keep you up at night. I would recommend it for any lenght of stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing good to say”
Reviews.Author: Churchview
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in October for my wedding in Rome, I have to say I was most disappointed with this hotel and it is the one and only thing I regret about my wedding in Rome. I booked bed and breakfast - this consisted of a cup of coffee - absolutely rediculous in my opinion. The real downfall of the hotel and the highlight of their bad service was when I walked down into the foyer ready to go to the church for my wedding with 2 bridesmaids they did not even look up from the reception - such bad manners. A simple "good luck" would have gone a long way. In short I could not recommend this hotel to anyone. Far too expensive for such bad service and unfrendliness.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: hazelpsu
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. The breakfast included was very good and had a lot of variety. We loved the location, very close to the Spanish steps. The triple room was large and the bathroom was very spacious. What we liked most about the hotel was that we could walk to the train station and overall it was a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved that hotel”
Reviews.Author: nata1Brooklyn
Reviews.Content: We like the hotel very much. Nice decor, convenient location, helpful stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: TheRfamily
Reviews.Content: Many Thanks to Nicola for all his personal attention to detail and care in assisting the planning of our site seeing each day. What a pleasure to see your warm and smiling face each day. Also thank you to all the Wonderful Staff of Hotel Victoria. My husband and our two teenage daughters had a wonderul three night stay at Hotel Victoria. Quiet, Safe Hotel centrally located to everything. Great Shopping, site seeing, Hard Rock Cafe. Parking was pefect and my Husband was helped with our bags on arrival and departure. What a pleasure. Thank you Francisco! The newly remodelled rooms were large, very clean, with new and comfy bedding. The spacious bathrooms were fantastic and the toiletries provided were more than perfect. We enjoyed a delicious and ellegantly displayed breakfast each morning. At night we used the internet access. Perfect! Each night we dined outside on the top balocony restaurant. Why go elsewhere. Dinner was delicious and served with style. Thank you Gian Luca, your profesional style, and cute humour entertained our family each night. We will recommend Hotel Victoria to our family and friends, and hope to visit again soon. The R Family

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: disneydl
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the trip advisor reviews we booked this hotel for two nights before our cruise. We had booked 7rooms for our group and everyone was very happy with the accommodations. The hotel was very clean and quaint. We had room #206 which was a beautiful large triple corner room with a nice big bathroom. The air conditioning was great even when we opened the shutters to take in the Rome atmosphere. We had a large king sized bed and a nice twin roll-a-way bed that nicely accommodated 3 people. One of the other rooms we booked was also a triple but not as large as ours. The doubles were nice but small, with nice bathrooms. The front desk people were very nice. They called cabs for us and had them waiting for us when we wanted them. They also held the luggage for all 17 of us until our vans arrived at 2pm to take us to our ship. The free breakfast was great and the roof top garden was very nice. We took a bottle of wine up there late one night and the staff even opened the bottle for us as we sat looking out at the skyline. We walked to the Pantheon one night and the walk was just beautiful. We felt safe in and around this hotel. We paid $156.38 US for the triple rooms and $120.38 US for the double rooms through orbitz..com - quite a bargain we felt for Rome in the summer. We would highly recommend this hotel especially if you need an inexpensive triple.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great location and accomodating staff”
Reviews.Author: sxeight
Reviews.Content: We had to leave another hotel across the street because of a broke air-conditioner and were relieved to find a room at this very nice hotel. The room and the bathroom were both large and the air conditioner worked well. AC can be touch-and-go in Italy in the summer. This was a well-run hotel with a convenient location in the Via Veneto area. Easy cab and public transportation access. The desk was manned 24 hours a day and the personnel were helpful. Reasonable price too. Will probably use this hotel in the future if and when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “great staff, okay accomodations, far from sites.”
Reviews.Author: tarter2
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in this hotel. Room was small, but adequate (larger than a paris room). bathroom was nice size, but no air conditioning in bathroom. I read on the airconditioning problems from prior. Our air took a little while to cool off room,but we didnt have any other problems after that. Staff was fabulous the gentleman who works nights is very accomodating and a pleasure to work with. All staff seemed to work hard to make sure you are enjoying your stay, and take pride in what they do. breakfast room was lovely, staff was nice and friendly and hard working. Different from what we see, but there is an egg, meat, cheese, and bread options so enough to take care of what you need. We did like the hotel but it was far from alot of things. We ended up taking taxis. There is a metro stop near by, but we found the metro expensive and not alot of travel options. Due to pick pockets we chose to stay off buses. Via Venneto is right next to the hotel. Lots of restuarants and food (Hard Rock for those Americans missing american food)

Reviews.Title: “"Hot, Hot, Hot"”
Reviews.Author: CarrieShepherd
Reviews.Content: Just returned on Thursday, July 3rd and stayed at the hotel the last 2 days of our trip. First impression was wonderful, hotel is clean and quaint. The front desk was helpful as well as the doormen. We booked 2 rooms since we were traveling with teenage girls and they needed their own space. Our room was fine until I sat my suitcase down by the window (no food inside my suitcase) and ants appeared from the window and walls. My husband went down stairs and told them of the problem and asked if they would come and spray and the woman attendant had said if we didn't open the window the ants would not have come. There was no signs anywhere saying don't open window!!! However the manager very kindly moved us to a different room which was much nicer than what we had booked. I would ask for a room on the spanish park side next time. The rooms airconditioning does not work very well or almost not at all. The temps were about 95-100 degrees and this is not acceptebale when your on the 5th floor. We had a really hard time sleeping at night and cooling down. The bathroom is equipped with everything you need except a blow dryer. The hotel will tell you they provide one but it is attached to the wall and looks like a vacuum cleaner. I found it to be awful!!! Thank heaven my daughter brought her own blow dryer that we all could share. Hotel has a beautiful bar/restraunt on the roof top but it was too hot to enjoy (bummer). I'm sure it would have been romantic with a glass of wine and the one you love. The breakfast buffet was okay but when they close down they are down right rude about waiting just one more minute to grab anything. We were always sleeping in since our bodies were having a hard time adjusting from all the different time zones we had experienced in the last few weeks. We checked out at 5:15 a.m. and we were suprised to see management up and greeting us. He didn't look awake but he was there as well as a doorman.

Reviews.Title: “Great Roof Top!”
Reviews.Author: Mr.Buffett
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Victoria proved to be a pleasant surprise the week of June 2nd. Although a little dated,this hotel is very clean and the staff is very attentive.The bathrooms are totally renovated! During the summer it's rooftop bar and dining was lovely overlooking the Borghese Gardens ! In addition you are located one block from the Via Veneto which is lovely and easy walking distance from the Spanish Steps,Trevi Fountain and the Pantheon...give it a try!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kalibre
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel with very helpful staff. Although the hotel isn't the most central, it is still within easy walk of all that rome has to offer. Very pleased. Oh and the roof terrace is nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Kanerva
Reviews.Content: We stayed six nights at Hotel Vicotoria for a holiday. The room was nice and clean. By the looks of bathroom/shower the room had also been recently renovated. Everything was very nice. Loved the little balcony. Staff was very nice and breakfast was good. Location is very good, near lovely Villa Borghese. Would stay there again and do recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: tigerpaw83
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Hotel Victoria. Our room was beautiful and clean. The staff was very helpful and kind. They even looked up and printed off train schedules for us one morning. The hotel is not centrally located, but it is a lovely, quiet area. Taxi and bus stops are very close and it is only a short walk from the Spanish Steps area. Breakfast is provided, which was very convenient and saved time and money. The staff in the breakfast area are very pleasant and attentive. I would certainly stay at Hotel Victoria in the event of a return trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Firth but not last rip to Hotel Victoria”
Reviews.Author: FamilyWiltshire
Reviews.Content: Booked a 3 night stay for my family (2 adults and 2 teenagers aged 16 and 13). I booked a family room but on arrival was informed that we could not have this room and was offered 2 interconnecting rooms instead. This worked out great - two bathrooms. The hotel was spotless, the reception staff could not be more helpful, especially when I realised that the travel plug I brought with me was the wrong type, they sent one to my room (free of charge) within 10 minutes. Breakfast was good and plentyful. The hotel was a little out of the way, but this meant it was really quiet at night. The hotel restaurant was quite expensive but would seem ok if there was only two of you but for a family, it was probably cheaper to eat outside of the hotel. If you come out of the hotel and turn down the street on the left, then take the first right, there is an excellent Pizzaria, great atmoshere, food and the prices quite reasonable. For daytime snack, walk to Via Ventre, turn left, walk across the road and walk a little way and there is an excellent bakery, sells bread, pastries and sandwiches etc. Tips: To get around,use the metro. Walk to end of road, steps down into a sort of underground tunnel, which you can walk to the metro or carry on walking and it come out at the Spanish Steps. Metro cost 1 euro for single journey or 4 euros for day pass. Spanish Steps, Travi fountain and Pantheon are all free and should be done together. Colesium - Take the metro - too far to walk. If taking children, take their passports with you, because if they are under 18 from EU and you have ID they get in free. Adult cost 9 euro. Do this with the Fora Romana (both in admission cost) and this should take all or most of a day. Drinks around the Colesium very expensive = 32 euro for 1 beer, 1 coffee and 2 cokes. so maybe take your own. Vatican - take a tour - this may seem expensive (around 25 euro each adult and 15 for child) but worth it. Without it you miss so much - with it you learn things you cannot find in any books. Admission is 14 euro for adult and 8 euro for child(on top of tour cost). the Basilica is free entry, but if you want to go in the tomb of St Peter and climb the tower you have to pay 6 euro. Coffee shop in Vatican sells drinks and snack and they were the cheapest we paid for in Rome!!! Drinks in Rome are quite expensive - 6 to 8 euro for 1/2 litre of beer, 5 to 6 euro for soft drink ie coke, coffee 5 to 6 euro, bottle of house wine around 25 euro, water 4 euro. Overall would I come again, most certainly, 3 nights is not enought to take in all Rome has to offer, but exhausting.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed with the Victoria”
Reviews.Author: BillBrewer
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from four nights at the Hotel Victoria. Although a bit out of the way it is well placed for the Metro so it's not too difficult to get to. We had a family room (three adults) and apart from the space taken by the "Z-bed" the room was plenty big enough, with a good bathroom. The only problem we had was trying to keep the room temperature down - we turned down the heating and kept a window open but it still felt a bit uncomfortable at times - having the window open meant that it was a bit noisy but, after all, you are in the middle of a bustling city so you expect that (it adds to the atmosphere!). Breakfast was more than adequate, with plenty of choice and the hotel seemed well used by Italian businessmen. In spite of what you may read in other reviews we found the staff pleasant, attentive and helpful - they arranged a taxi to the airport for five adults and luggage at 6:30a.m. on a Sunday at a very reasonable rate. You can eat in the hotel at night for 30 Euros (drinks extra) but I would recommend using one of the many local restaurants, which give plenty of choice and authentic Italian food/wine all at very reasonable prices. I would certainly return to this hotel and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Victoria”
Reviews.Author: Lorr2007
Reviews.Content: I had my first trip to Rome for three nights in December 2007, I loved the city and definetely would love to return some time. Three of us stayed at the hotel Victoria in the Villa Borghese area, it was a lovely 4 star hotel in an ideal location. The hotel room was comfortable and to a high standard, the continental buffet breakfast was lovely and had plenty of choice for Vegetarians like myself. In the 3 days that we stayed in Rome we managed to visit all of the desired attractions, including the Spanish steps, The Pantheon, Trevi fountain, Colliseum and the Vatican we visited on the Monday. The Vatican is the one place we had to queue to get into , there were many tour guides approaching us to say that we could skip the queue and the 2hour wait for an extra 30 euros each , however we refused them and decided to wait in line, the queue was constantly moving and it took approx 45 mins to wait so it wasnt as bad as they tell you. The Vatican is a must to see , it takes several hours to walk around it all as there is just so much to see. We actually took the Subway to get to the Vatican and this was a good way to get around, you can buy a day pass which allowed us to jump on and off the subway and get to many places in minutes. I definetely plan to return to Rome some time and would like to stay in the Victoria Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Location...Location.....”
Reviews.Author: liljro
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Victoria for 5 days and overall it was fantastic. We loved the location and the staff was very courteous and helpful guiding us to all the attractions. I loved that we had a small balcony in our room and at night the streets are safe to roam around. Breakfast was included on our stay so it saved us alot of money. There are many restaurants to choose from and since we are from Los Angeles, CA we truly enjoyed seing a Hard Rock Cafe nearby. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great Rome hotel near Via Veneto and Borghese Park”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelerya
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Victoria Hotel for one week in Dec. 2007. At first we weren't sure about the location, but after exploring the Borghese Park we decided we wouldn't have wanted to stay anywhere else. Probably the most beautiful place in Rome. The Galleria Borghese is very close to the hotel is definitely worth seeing, some of the best paintings and sculptures in the world. Via Veneto is one street over and is a beautifully tree lined street with many shops and restaurants. For the major tourist sites, take the underground tunnel, towards the Spanish steps metro, which seemed to be busy at all hours, it comes out right next to the Spanish steps, from there you can walk to the Trevi fountain, Piazza Navona, etc. The hotel itself is very clean and came with a breakfast buffet. We booked on expedia.ca and paid only $160 a night, which is a bargain for Rome. Since we were travelling with a two year old, we preferred to eat at Trattoria's, but also found Fraterna Domus, which is a type of B&B which also serves lunch and supper, you must book ahead though as it is a very popular place with tourists and locals. You will get a starter (pasta), a main dish, a salad and dessert for about 15 Euro which is very cheap for Rome. All in all, I would stay at the Victoria Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Victoria”
Reviews.Author: HappyWicklow
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 glorious nights in the Victoria Hotel in Rome, the hotel though a bit out of the centre of Rome on the edge of the Villa Borghese Gardens is a real GEM. Room was very comfortable and quiet spacious, bathroom well supplied with toiletries - cleaned every day and the bed turned down at night. No tea/coffee making facilities in the room in case anyone assumes there is. Hairdryer ladies or gents is supplied. The staff were friendly and helpful at ALL TIMES. American buffet breakfast was great and loads to choose from, set you up for a day of walking around Rome. Every attraction in Rome (and there are many) are within walking distance, the metro line is a couple of minutes from the hotel. I recommend you bring comfortable walking shoes and that you do walk. You really see and feel so much more of the city. The Vatican is within 45 minutes walk and I recommend that you take the guided tour, it is about €25 per person plus the cost of the entrance fee, it is well worth it to get the full history behind this fantastic piece of history. Another guided tour is the one of the Colosseum and the Forum is about €10 per person again plus the entrance fee. Eating out is not expensive and try the eateries where the locals eat always a good bet. Our personal favourite was IL Pomodorio is was the best friendly & helpful staff, great atmosphere and food to die for. The house red wine is very special and leave room for dessert !!!! This restaurant is a 2 minute walk from the front door of the hotel, another one that is good is La Bruschetta around the corner from the hotel very small and cosy. Be aware of the American Bar on a side street off the Via Vento (main road near hotel) it is down stairs in a basement, you are invited in off the street as you pass by a very well dressed gentleman, we ordered a large beer and small beer, got a very uncomfortable feeling about the place and felt as though we were intruding, it was the only time we felt like this in Rome. We finished our drinks and left after being ripped off to the tune of €24 - don't get caught out there. There are plenty of other good bars and cafe bars around which are much more enjoyable and welcoming. Most of all enjoy and have fun in this beautiful city. This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC. * You cannot edit your review after you submit it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not aa 4 star.Shame about the staff”
Reviews.Author: patncolin
Reviews.Content: Initial impressions were good. Hotel seemed nice. The rooms were small but well designed,and the beds were comfy.The hotel and rooms were all clean. There was no aircon so options were to have windows open and be be disturbed throughout the night by passing revellers or bake.The rooms were also noisy from the inside the hotel and you could hear everything from the corridor outside and neighbours using bathroom facilites.The rooms were lacking the finer touches of a 4 star,hotel they only had 2 pillows..one each,no coffee facilities , the towels were very thin which meant I had to share,there was only shampoo and soap..no hair conditioners or shower gels. The restaraunt was okay especially if you have the fixed menu.The bit that really let the hotel everything was to much trouble and why are you disturbing me to just outright rude . The actual hotel was a long walk from any of the maor attractions

Reviews.Title: “Friendly clean hotel in a lovely part of the city”
Reviews.Author: SineadO
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth trip to Rome and I've never stayed in this part of town before, the hotel is slightly outside of the main drag, near to the Villa Borghese park and the city walls. Was concerned that it would be a hassle getting about but it wasn't at all, it's a lovely walk down Via Veneto to the Metro and only a stroll to the Spanish Steps.
