Taxis are cheap and there's a rank just down from the hotel, it was easy to jump in to one if we wanted to travel a bit further afield, i.e. 8 euro fare to Trastevere, for dinner one evening - restaurant All Fratte de Trastevere, lovely staff, ask for the daily specials. Another nice restaurant we went to was Caffe Bernini on Piazza Navona, surprisingly good food, esp. pasta, and great service, despite the touristy location where most restaurants are formulaic and average. The staff in the hotel itself couldn't be more pleasant or welcoming, the room was a little dated but had VERY comfortable beds, a big bathroom and was spotlessy clean. Would definitely stay there again, good value.. Only downside to trip was being ripped off by taxi driver from airport to hotel, fare is supposed to be fixed, but he gave us some bullsh*t story about only applying to certain taxis which is not true and took us on the long route around the city centre.. hence 57 euro instread of 30. Make sure and agree the fixed fare before you start the journey.

Reviews.Title: “Typically Italian....”
Reviews.Author: MicandAnd
Reviews.Content: Date: 27th - 30th Sept. I arrived at the hotel after haggling taxi costs at the airport. I was greeted in a very chaotic manner as there was a huge party in from the States and the reception was busy. This hotel is extremely old fashioned and typically Italian in style. We had a very large room on the 4th floor. Big, spacious room with a lovely table, chairs, two wardrobes, big hallway, bureau and lovely flat screen tv! We had two big windows in our room too. We were very happy with the size of the room, just wished it had tea and coffee making facilities in the room. They had good room service which incidently the hotel is going to charge 5EUR from October per room service order. The bathroom was very big although the water in the shower was very tempermental and very difficult to set, it was either too hot or too cold and the shower head was not powerful. The bathroom was in need of some grouting and perhaps replacing the shower would have been better. They did think of things like toiletries, hairdryer, the even had a huge maginified mirror only it was stuck in the corner low down by a shelf in the bathroom that you had to stretch over the sink to look into the mirror - lousy positioning. Breatfast was basic but adequate. The staff were helpful and the service a little slow, but on the whole it was a good stay. Location was good 10 mins from everything. We were by Borgese park which is gorgous. Around the corner from Via Veneto, 15 mins from Spanish Steps, Trevi. We used the open top bus to get to most places. It is cheaper to use the bus and they have a 24 hour ticket and you can hop on and off as please. We were about 20 mins in a taxi to the Vatican. We had booked a tour but still had to queue to enter the Vatican - worth the wait.

Reviews.Title: “A gem!”
Reviews.Author: SJohnston
Reviews.Content: The Victoria exceeded our expectations, not only for its standard, service and comfort, but also the location is perfect, close enough to the action, yet quiet too. The decor in our room was beautifully tasteful with quality furniture and fittings. The breakfast buffet was good, varied and plentiful, served by happy, helpful staff. The hotel is located on a quiet side street, very near the top of Via Veneto and its quality shops. We felt perfectly safe walking to/from the hotel day or night. Plenty of good restaurants nearby, frequented by Italians (always a good sign!). Would recommend Il Pommodoro, you can see it’s yellow awnings as you turn right out of the hotel. Easy, and interesting walks to the Spanish Steps (c. 10 mins) & the Trevi Fountain and the main shopping areas of Trintone & Via del Corsa (c. 15/20 mins). Historical sites are not that clearly signposted, would recommend purchasing a good street map of Rome before you leave home. Using the side roads as shortcuts saved us a lot time and energy, and we saw more of real life Rome at the same time. The hotel is a 10 minute taxi ride away from Vatican City, and a 5/10 minute taxi ride from Termini Station (every half an hour there’s an excellent 30 minute non-stop train from Fiomicino Airport to Termini called the Leonardo Express). Across the road from the hotel is the fabulous Villa Borghese, acres of gorgeous parkland and activities, a wonderful oasis after serious sightseeing or shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: BonnieL0789
Reviews.Content: I am an agent and spent significant time researching hotel properties for our visit at the end of August. We had formerly stayed at the Parco de Principi, also near Borghese but were not willing to pay the current price. We had a wonderful room on the fourth floor. AC worked perfectly since we were there during a very warm time. Room and bath were spotless. Front deck staff wonderful as well as the concierge who offered wonderful advice to hotel guests. I sat the morning of our departure waiting for our taxi and overheard several conversations I thought extremely helpful. This hotel is in a perfect location. Within walking distance of Trevi and Spanish Steps. Two blocks from Via Veneto shopping and restaurants plus a main subway station. Breakfast very typical European buffet and thought it wonderful. Excellent freshly baked breads, eggs, bacon, cereals, yogurts, fresh fruits; can't imagine what anyone else would want. This is a typical European hotel. You cannot compare it to US chain properties....or to the breakfast included in a US chain hotel. But, that's not what I look for in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't what was expected !”
Reviews.Author: KRSTucson_Az
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights the first of September. Upon check in given room #102. Refigerator (mini bar) was not operating and advised the front desk at 12:00 noon as to the problem and the fact we needed to refrigerate a medication. They said they would change it immediately. We left the hotel & returned 6 hours later to find the same problem. Finally replaced that evening, new one did not cool properly. The room air conditioning would only drop temperature to around 83 degrees and never stopped in three days. We found that if we opened the bathroom windows and closed the door the bedroom area would cool enough to sleep comfortably. On the plus side, the location was fantastic and we had very good meals along the Via Veneto (just 2 block walk). After 3 weeks touring Italy the ending stay at Hotel Victoria left alot to be desired compared to all the other similar hotels in the same catagory. We would not stay here again. Roberts & Smith/ Tucson, AZ

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Up”
Reviews.Author: user6715
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week for six nights. We had a 18 month old baby with us. Room was spacious. Staff was very nice and friendly. There was a nice selection for morning breakfast. They even had a highchair for our daughter. Overall nothing to complain about the hotel itself. As far as the location: on the plus side it is very close to via Veneto: good shopping, restaurants and right across from the Borghese Gardens. On the down side, there is a long walk (which is uphill on the return to the hotel) to the nearest metro stop at Barberini. All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: BCGibson
Reviews.Content: We booked for one night having looked at the web site pictures. On arrival our room was obviously one of the ones which had not yet been refurbished. It was stark, drab and had an uncomfortable bed. Was not four star quality, would barely have made 3 star. Breakfast was ok but nothing special. Reception staff were not very helpful when we asked for a later checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Best, Not the Worst”
Reviews.Author: JosephL
Reviews.Content: Family of 4 stayed for 3 nights in one large room. Picked this hotel as it was very difficult to book 4 people in one room. Room on first floor had king and 2 singles that were pull out from couch. Adequate space. Bathroom was huge-2 basins and large shower/tub. Minimal street noise but Rome was empty but for tourists. Breakfast was acceptable with the usual fare. No fresh fruit was disappointing. Hotel was very clean and well maintained. It is a little dated but not to the point it makes a difference. Service was so/so. No printer to print boarding passes, no maps of buses/subways although they did provide bus numbers/directions to attractions. Booked tours through big/unpersonal company-can't remember the name. Location of hotel was not bad-easily walk to Spanish Steps/Trevi Fountain and Pantheon. One bus to Forum/Maximus.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LouiseNewZealand
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel in a nice location (very close, 5 mins walk toAvis drop of desk) Rooms very nice althoug on the small size All the staff really helpful

Reviews.Title: “There are nicer places and more helpful”
Reviews.Author: Zanobil
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through an on-line service in February 2007 for a July visit. Called and confirmed the reservation a week before our arrival. When we got there after driving 7 hours in the car from Venice, they had given our rooms away (there were 7 of us and 3 rooms). They did put us up in another hotel across town, a much nicer hotel I have to say, but it was only for one night and we had to return to the Victoria the following day - our last day in Rome. This was a terrible inconvenience as we were traveling with our parents in their 70s and three teenage girls and we all just wanted to put our stuff down and relax for our last two days. The rooms were nice, but not close together, as requested - one was not even on the same floor. And the rooms' floors shook from just the traffic on the street. There was no shuttle service to the airport as the booking service had indicated (one of the reasons we chose this hotel over others), but the evening staff said they could call us a cab! Well, we could do that much too. The staff (particularly late afternoon and evening) was generally unhelpful in answering any questions, and offering any suggestions for anything at all, including setting up any tours of sites. (We were able to set them up through the other hotel.) This was to be our last days in Rome before heading home after two and a half weeks in Italy, and we were very disappointed with the Victoria. Overall, I would not stay here again; I would call the Grand Plaza on Via del Corso next time, or rent an apartment like we did everywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed in better in rome”
Reviews.Author: Italyleeds
Reviews.Content: On arrival we where given room 407 dark and slighty smelly. Our travelling companions were on the 1st Floor I think this had just been refurbished. We were moved straight away to be on the same floor. This room was much better but small and shower even worse. There was not much choice at breakfast and very busy. One guy on reception was great very friendly and could not do enough to please, gave us directions to a family run restaurant that did fantastic pasta not the usual tourist food. The hotel is situated in a very nice area of Rome and within easy walk of Spanish Steps.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Victoria”
Reviews.Author: deedydiamond
Reviews.Content: After three days in Paris it was such a pleasure to be greeted at The Victoria Hotel in Rome with open arms. Rome has the friendliest people. Our staff at the Victoria Hotel went above and beyond to make our stay a memorable one. The food was excellent , the rooms are nice and everything works. Europeans are not big on ice like we Americans are and since there are no ice machines our floor waiter made sure we got a large bowl of ice everyday. We witnessed the staff running errands for guests and even taking one lonely couple out for dinner. I have stayed in many hotels in many places and I have never been treated as kindly as I was at the Victoria. Highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: PHIZ
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at Hotel Victoria (May 21-25, 07). The rooms are small but clean. The bathroom is small but up to date. The room although small, was reasonably comfortable. New carpet, new curtains and pretty quiet. The breakfast is sufficient. The conscierge service is inconsistent. Some of them give good advice, others say they really don't know much about the restaurants, etc. We got lucky twice and learned about a quaint neigborhood restaurant with great food within walking distance. There is a pastry shop around the corner which is a great place to buy water, snacks, etc. The best thing about this hotel is its location. Some of the major sights are within walking distance and its cloness to Via Veneto (a major avenue) makes it convenient in the evenings to walk to a cafe or bar for drinks and people watching.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: CTTravelerM
Reviews.Content: The Victoria was a clean, quiet, enjoyable accomodation. It was a bit of a schlep to some of the sites, and the closest Metro was about a 15 minute walk. The hotel was extremely convenient to the Borghese Gallery. The neighborhood around the hotel is great - plenty of bars & restaurants and we felt very safe. The bar and restaurant on the roof is lovely and the food was quite good. The staff is almost comically concerned about whether one is sitting in the "bar" area or the "restaurant" area on the roof, however. We just made sure the bartender knew whether we were there for drinks or food and let him tell us where to sit. Breakfast was fine - not a lot of variety but plenty to eat and it was all high quality. We were a little disappointed in the staff at the desk - we needed some help figuring out the bus system and they weren't really able to help out - there was a tour group staying there at the same time as us, and I think they were taking a lot of the staff's time. Overall it was a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is Fine”
Reviews.Author: PKM10
Reviews.Content: We spent our last night in Rome at the Hotel Victoria. We arrived in the early evening after a long day on the train from Florence. Rather than helping us with our bags upon arrival, the staff ignored us until we asked for help. When we arrived in our room, we requested an extra pillow and were told by the bellman that housekeeping was closed and it wouldn't be possible. Around midnight when we called the front desk and asked again, a pillow was brought right away. The air conditioning didn't work very well and it was unseasonably warm in Rome that week. The breakfast buffet was comparable to others in Italy but we were never acknowledged by the wait staff and never got coffee service before we had to leave for the airport. When the front desk staff realized we had a driver picking us up for the airport and we had proven to be polite as well as "good tippers", we were suddenly given some help. The location of the hotel is interesting but far too great a distance from the sites of interest. Yes, it's a quiet location but everything is either a cab ride or long walk away. We wouldn't stay there again. But if location isn't important to you and you prefer a quiet location with mediocre service, you'll find this elegant hotel lovely. And it is definitely a pretty hotel with nice, albeit small, rooms. Our other days in Rome were spent at Albergo del Senato and it was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay at Victoria Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kateBelfast
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Victoria hotel. The room was excellent, exactly how it how it appeared on the website. The staff were friendly, helpful and courteous. The breakfast was very good and as a party of three we would all recommend this hotel for a pleasant stay in Rome. The hotel is within easy walking distance of the Metro, Spanish Steps, bars and restaurants. The staff organised for an item that had been forgotten in the room to be sent back to Ireland after our stay and their help was much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: piper5403
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very nice area. The room was small, but nice and clean. Keep in mind Europe has different standards for nice. It is well located if you want to see some of the better known sights like the Pantheon, Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. The desk staff was extremely helpful and helped us book a fantastic tour of the Vatican and St. Peter's Basilica. The continental breaskfast was very nice. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: DeerRun
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Hotel Victoria. We planned our trip with only 4 weeks notice, and had difficulty finding a quality hotel with a quad room available. Most only have 1-2 of these, and it seemed all were booked. We settled on The Victoria despite it being farther away from where we wanted to be. The internet rate was good, and the room was essentially a large corner room on the 2nd floor. Clean, well-appointed, with good space. Three large windows that opened and brought the breeze through. They were new windows, heavy construction, and kept the sound OUT. Bathroom was slightly dated, but clean. Breakfast was included, and it was good. Staff was friendly, helpful, and made arrangements for us as requested. Hotel is across the street from Villa Borghese (park), and the nearby subway station had a long tunnel that connected us with the fun Piazza di Spagna area.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect!”
Reviews.Author: maugham
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from a wonderful trip to Italy; we were in Rome from April 21st to April 24th. I chose the Hotel Victoria for a number of reasons: I needed a good location, I wanted a hotel with a large "family" room so my wife and two boys (ages 8 and 12) could stay in one room, and I wanted someplace that was clean. I relied heavily on the reviews posted in Trip Advisor when it came to choosing the Victoria. Because we booked early through an internet service, we received a good rate. First, we found the location to be perfect for us -- close enough to walk to the major sights, but secluded enough to offer some peace and quiet. The hotel was ideally situated next to the Villa Borghese, and the neighborhood was very quiet. It was a welcome sanctuary after a hectic day taking in the sights of Rome. A great coincidence was that the location for our rental car pickup, Avis, was pretty much right next to the hotel; it was easy to drive from there to the main highway north to Tuscany, which was our next stop. The hotel is right off Via Veneto, and a very easy walk to the Trevi fountain, the Pantheon, Piazza Navono and the Spanish Steps. The Colisseum, Palantine Hill and the Forum are about a 30 minute walk away, which we walked as well. My 8-year-old really loved walking everywhere, especially with the many stops for gelato; to us, seeing Rome while walking was one of the most enjoyable aspects of our trip. We did take a taxi to St. Peter's, which is a quick ride away. The hotel itself was low-key and charming. The front desk was very helpful in making dinner reservations and suggestions for us, and the bartender was very friendly. The perfect end to our day was getting drinks at the bar and taking them up to the lovely rooftop terrace. We only had breakfast at the Victoria once, but found it to be fine -- a basic buffet-style breakfast with a reasonable selection. Our room and bathroom were large and immaculately clean. People used to "American" style hotels may have an issue with how to take a shower without a proper shower curtain; the key is to sit down in the tub, and don't worry about getting water on the floor -- that's what the drain is for. Overall, we found the Victoria to be the perfect hotel for our situation -- if you're looking to be more in the middle of where the big sights are or are looking for a larger, more upscale hotel, it may not be your cup of tea. However, we will highly recommend the Victoria to family and friends traveling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Victoria”
Reviews.Author: glc74
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay in the Hotel Victoria! It is in a quiet area (we slept with the windows open & no problems with noise), but very close to the Spagna metro station, and also a taxi stand just a few yards down the street. The Galleria Borghese is about a 3 minute walk, and about 15 minute walk to the Pantheon, Trevi, etc. Breakfast was the best breakfast we had during our 10 day trip to Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Choice for Family”
Reviews.Author: chavgopal
Reviews.Content: As noted in other reviews, you couldn't ask for a better location. It was clean, the staff were helpful and the roll-out beds for the two kids were adequate. The breakfasts were also very good. Overall, a very solid choice about which you will not be disappointed. On the other side of the coin, there is little amazing about it either. I would do it again -- but make sure you are happy with the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Fred1976
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights, the people at the front desk were helpful and always willing to give advice. The location of the hotel was very good, its ten min away from the spainsh steps and the metro. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: abefromen
Reviews.Content: Victoria Courteous daytime concierge. Stuffy nighttime concierge. Very helpful and friendly bellhop named Clemente. Breakfast is good with a decent buffet selection. The wait staff bring you all the cappuccino’s and coffee you want. Great to load up because they’re free and quite good. Hotel elevator is very small but not a problem because the bellhop brings your luggage to your room. Our room was small but we expected that from other reviews. We had no problems with space. Keep your luggage upright against the wall, in the closet or under the desk and it will not be in your way. We had 5 bags and made do just fine. The room was clean with lots of character. Separate shower room was nice. The place was only a little noisy when we came back to our room for siesta at 6pm. Bed was hard but we slept fine. Our room was non-smoking, although it appeared our floor was not (or people didn’t follow the rules). A few times we smelled cigarette smoke in the hallway and it came into the room a bit. The clientele seemed to be mainly business persons there for a day or so, this may change during high-season as we were there in Nov./Dec. We used the dry cleaning service, which was easy and excellent. All in all we’d stay here again. It’s not the Four Seasons/Westin but the location is fantastic, a couple blocks from the Westin and right across from Harry’s Bar. A very expensive, seemingly safe area. Best of all you’re right across the street from Villa Bourghese Park, which has some of the most amazing views of Rome. A great place to take it all in. There is no wifi available in the room, they do have a computer downstairs that they will allow you to use (5 euros for 30 minutes). There is WiFi available across the street at the park, but you need an "Orange Account" to access it. I suggest buying the account before you travel, it's basically like a prepaid phone card for WiFi. The Orange Wifi Account can be used all over Europe which is nice. TAXI TIP: When taking a taxi to/from the airports there is new law that says Taxi’s can only charge a flat fee of 30 or 40 Euros (for all hotels within the Aleutian walls) depending on the airport. The Victoria Hotel IS within the walls. The taxi drivers do not like this law and may try to ignore it, beware. There is literature in the airport on this new law. We found this out the hard way AFTER paying 70 euros for the Taxi to the hotel, live and learn right? The drivers inside of the airport are private drivers who will try to take you in their private cars…needless to say this isn’t a good idea because they aren’t governed by anyone. Always look for the White Taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: just_journeying
Reviews.Content: The adjoining rooms were just what we needed for our party of six. The corner room was quite large and suited 3 persons adequately. Some of the hotel staff were more helpful than others. We had no problem until the last day with getting help. The breakfast suited our needs well and the waitstaff was very attentive during our stay. I would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel let down by the staff.”
Reviews.Author: glmp
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a lovely trip to rome and the Victoria hotel.the hotel was nice,clean and in a good location,but one of our group had jewellary taken from her room while out sightseeing.When it was reported to the manager he basically said there was nothing he could do and maybe she had missplaced it! There was no offer to investigate the theft or contact the police to report it.The room had not been broken into and therefore we presume it was a member of staff. We left the Victoria with a sour taste in our mouthes but a great fondness for Rome! So avoid the Victoria and if you have already booked take your valuables out with you during the day!!

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: ALSStourbridge
Reviews.Content: Good location inside the original Rome wall. Near Villa Borghese. £5.00 in a taxi from the terminus (where the airport shuttles arrive/depart) taxi recommended as slightly up hill, but can walk it, we did there, but decided on taxi back. Rooms spotless nicely appointed with small balcony. Nice public areas reception lounges. Breakfast was fine to set you up for the day. Hotel staff very helpful. Can walk to all attractions but nearest Spanish steps. Felt safe in hotel - two ladies travelling alone. Local restaurents used by locals, good pizza's. Definitely would stay here again well worth the little extra money.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: vaArlington
Reviews.Content: Hotel Victoria was an incredibly clean & spacious hotel. The bathroom was spotless & the bed was comfortable. There is a rooftop terrace which is quite nice (even went up there in Dec), as well as a restaurant & bar. We didn't eat in the restaurant, but the bar service was nice. It is in walking distance to many attractions, although it said it was in the spanish steps area, which is actually a 20 min. walk away. Lovely hotel, I would highly recommend it if you find a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Miguel&Tulio
Reviews.Content: The Victoria Hotel is truly a great place to stay in Rome. I could possibly and positively state that this hotel was one of the best parts of my visit to Rome this week. The room was not large but very clean and well maintained, the bathroom very large, new and very very clean. Breakfast was simple but if you remember to ask for a cappuccino instead of the standard hotel coffee you have an instant upgrade for the day. It's a nice place I would easily recommend. Being situated on the far side of central Rome is the only drawback to this hotel. Either you walk a lot, back and forth, or your taxi bills add fast and high, especially when going out to dine at night. The staff is friendly and helpful. Rome was funny enough - they just try to rip you off on every step no matter what you do. And it is EXPENSIVE. Big time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: SRQRedhead
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Roma was in an interesting location at the top of the Via Vittorio Veneto and essentially across the street from the Borghese Gardens (it was a very short walk). The rooms are a little on the smaller side compared to other hotels we stayed at in Venice and Florence, but it was very clean and the bathroom was tight, but you could move around without hitting any fixtures. The beds were a bit hard and the sheets were so tight you had to untuck them to be comfortable. The breakfast room was ok, it is on two levels. The staff were not terribly accomodating - we had a part of 6 and always had to split up 4 and 2 and sometimes they would leave you standing waiting to show you to a table. Food was ok - not quite sure how they got the eggs to be that slightly orange color...but they tasted fine. The desk staff were not very outgoing. They would answer a direct question, but that was it - no offering of advice or suggestions. The roof garden was very pretty, it was a bit hard to get a drink up there - you had to go down to the bar and cajole the barman to bring up the drinks. Several excellent restaurants in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ninarital
Reviews.Content: I have been to Rome over 20 times. This is my second stay at the Victoria and it was better than the first. I love the location. It is convenient to everything but has the feel of a quiet neighborhood. The staff could not have been nicer especially Massimo, Adriano and Diego. Our room was wonderful and we had a small balconey. The breakfast was more than adequate and Marco and Alessandro were both friendly and kind. Some of the other breakfast staff need to lighten up and smile! The roof garden is a great place to unwind after a busy day. Diego is there to help you choose a drink and relax. There is a super restaurant one block away, Il Pomodorino where you can get very good food ," troppo economico." When I return to Rome next year there is no question that I will be staying at the Victoria. Mille grazie a tutti!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Simba2005
Reviews.Content: Location, Location, Location....we were so pleased with the location next to Via Veneto and Villa Borghese Park. We suggest to give yourself an evening tour of the Galleria Borgheses and taken a stroll in the park--amny interesting things to see as well as a great way to see the locals. The outside noise was minimal but the inside noise could be heard fairly easy around 7am--housekeeping, next door room and upstairs room. However, the rooms were spacious and the bathroom was huge. The hotel was very clean and offered a nice breakfast. The staff, however made the place not so appealing. Upon check in we found out that through the American Express Corporate Web Site the reservation booked for one person for 4 nights. However, our recepit did not state how many people it was booking for-it just stated how many nights and how many rooms. There was no comprimise, the hotel told us it would be an extra 60 Euros for the second person each night. We cut our Rome visit short one night and stayed three nights instead. The Bernini fountain is just down Via Veneto were there is the Metro and the Spanish Steps are just a walk as well were there is also a Metro. The Via Veneto is a main street-that is long, but safe and a nice walk. The Metro is a nice way to save money as taci's love to charge more as well as take you in a different location. Be sure to know your way back from to the hotel before getting into a cab. All Restaurants in Rome charge both for Service and Cooperato & Panne. Both of these charges make for an expensive meal. There are many small Tobacco shops around that you can pre purchase the Metro tickets, Water and snacks for the day.

Reviews.Title: “August 24-27th, 2006”
Reviews.Author: cyprusbound
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at this hotel from August 24th through to the 27th, booked through hotelclub.com at a rate of $75/night canadian. A pleasant hotel, close to everything Rome has to offer. the walls are thin so there were times the hall and other room noises were bothersome, but all in all, a great, old, hotel with lots of charm. Definitely worth far more than the rate we paid.

Reviews.Title: “quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: Friarsdene
Reviews.Content: hotel was of a high quality clean and staff courteous. Breakfast is basic but ample. The room was good but not as good as the pictures. Location is at the top of the Via Veneto, so a 5Eu taxi ride takes you to the centre of the city. We found the piazza Navona the best place for food and to watch the world go by
